reviewText: I show this to my DUI Program clients often. It does give a VERY personal perspective (from the DUI offender's position!), of HOW SHOULD a DUI offender be punished, and IF incarceratation IS adequate. For those of you who have long-term "BFF's", this movie will make you think twice.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: James C. Ward "horror and sci-fi fan.."
reviewText: this ABC 20/20 documentary examines an actual case of DUI manslaughter which occurred in the mid-2000's.  Two teenage best friends, after a night of partying and drinking alcohol, crash into a tree on their way home.  The driver of the car survives, her friend doesn't.What follows in this story are interviews with the driver, the passenger's parents, the driver's parents, and the prosecuting attorney.this video is especially helpful for teens and young adults in their 20's who often takes risks when it comes to drinking and driving.*** highly recommended ***
summary: outstanding- examines the legal, ethical issues of DUI manslaughter

reviewText: Excellent resource!!!!!!!!!!!!  Great to open up honest communication and arguements in the classroom.  Very pertinent to today's teens.  Would use it in a speech class, english, life skills, drug education.

reviewText: Film provides a strong message and is a gateway for discussion on a wide range of topics; alcohol and drug use, alcohol and drugged driving, DUI laws, consequences, choices and their affects on us and others, friendships, conscience and right and wrong, acceptance, and more. Leads to insightful exchanges and self reflection on our own driving experiences and choices involving drugs and alcohol.
summary: Terrific new addition to DUI Camp
